div.p: PON1, PTE and CAII substrates used in the different directed evolution experiments: lactones (1-4), esters (5-7, 10) and phosphotriesters (8)(9).
O O R S O O O O O O R2 O R1 O R O O O O P O EtO EtO R1 R2 O P O EtO EtO O O O O O NO 2 R P O EtO EtO O O O O O O O O 8a R1=CN R2=H 8b R1=H R2=Cl
1a R=H 2 3 4 5a R1=H R2=CH 3 5b R1=NO 2 R2=CH 3 5c R1=NO 2 R2=(CH 2 ) 6 CH 3 6a R=CH 3 6b R=(CH 2 ) 6 CH 3 6c R=(CH 2 ) 10 CH 3 7 Lactones Esters 9a R=H 9b R=F Phosphotriesters 1b R=C 3 H 7

The lactone substrates include: γ-butyrolactones (1), γ-butyrothiolactone, (2) δvalerolactone (3) and dihydrocoumarin (4). The esters include: phenyl esters ( 5), e.g., phenyl acetate (5a); naphtyl esters ( 6), e.g., 2-naphtylacetate (6a) and 2-naphtyl octanoate (6b); O-acetoxy-7-hydroxycoumarin (7); and, carboxy flourescein diacetate (10). The phosphotriesters include: the organophosphate DEPCyC (8a), coumaphousoxon (8b), paraoxon (9a) and its 2-flouro derivative (9b).
